Browse the source code of netbsd/external/lgpl3/mpfr/dist/src/fma.c

7

9it under the terms of the GNU Lesser General Public License as published by
10the Free Software Foundation; either version 3 of the License, or (at your
11option) any later version.
12
13The GNU MPFR Library is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but
14WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY
15or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU Lesser General Public
16License for more details.
17
18You should have received a copy of the GNU Lesser General Public License
19along with the GNU MPFR Library; see the file COPYING.LESSER. If not, see
20http://www.gnu.org/licenses/ or write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
2151 Franklin St, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA 02110-1301, USA. */

23#define MPFR_NEED_LONGLONG_H
24#include "mpfr-impl.h"
25
26/* The fused-multiply-add (fma) of x, y and z is defined by:
27 fma(x,y,z)= x*y + z
28*/
29
30/* this function deals with all cases where inputs are singular, i.e.,
31 either NaN, Inf or zero */
32static int
33mpfr_fma_singular (mpfr_ptr s, mpfr_srcptr x, mpfr_srcptr y, mpfr_srcptr z,
34 mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode)
35{
36 if (MPFR_IS_NAN(x) || MPFR_IS_NAN(y) || MPFR_IS_NAN(z))
37 {
38 MPFR_SET_NAN(s);
39 MPFR_RET_NAN;
40 }
41 /* now neither x, y or z is NaN */
42 else if (MPFR_IS_INF(x) || MPFR_IS_INF(y))
43 {
44 /* cases Inf*0+z, 0*Inf+z, Inf-Inf */
45 if ((MPFR_IS_ZERO(y)) ||
46 (MPFR_IS_ZERO(x)) ||
47 (MPFR_IS_INF(z) &&
48 ((MPFR_MULT_SIGN(MPFR_SIGN(x), MPFR_SIGN(y))) != MPFR_SIGN(z))))
49 {
50 MPFR_SET_NAN(s);
51 MPFR_RET_NAN;
52 }
53 else if (MPFR_IS_INF(z)) /* case Inf-Inf already checked above */
54 {
55 MPFR_SET_INF(s);
56 MPFR_SET_SAME_SIGN(s, z);
57 MPFR_RET(0);
58 }
59 else /* z is finite */
60 {
61 MPFR_SET_INF(s);
62 MPFR_SET_SIGN(s, MPFR_MULT_SIGN(MPFR_SIGN(x) , MPFR_SIGN(y)));
63 MPFR_RET(0);
64 }
65 }
66 /* now x and y are finite */
67 else if (MPFR_IS_INF(z))
68 {
69 MPFR_SET_INF(s);
70 MPFR_SET_SAME_SIGN(s, z);
71 MPFR_RET(0);
72 }
73 else if (MPFR_IS_ZERO(x) || MPFR_IS_ZERO(y))
74 {
75 if (MPFR_IS_ZERO(z))
76 {
77 int sign_p;
78 sign_p = MPFR_MULT_SIGN( MPFR_SIGN(x) , MPFR_SIGN(y) );
79 MPFR_SET_SIGN(s, (rnd_mode != MPFR_RNDD ?
80 (MPFR_IS_NEG_SIGN(sign_p) && MPFR_IS_NEG(z) ?
81 MPFR_SIGN_NEG : MPFR_SIGN_POS) :
82 (MPFR_IS_POS_SIGN(sign_p) && MPFR_IS_POS(z) ?
83 MPFR_SIGN_POS : MPFR_SIGN_NEG)));
84 MPFR_SET_ZERO(s);
85 MPFR_RET(0);
86 }
87 else
88 return mpfr_set (s, z, rnd_mode);
89 }
90 else /* necessarily z is zero here */
91 {
92 MPFR_ASSERTD(MPFR_IS_ZERO(z));
93 return mpfr_mul (s, x, y, rnd_mode);
94 }
95}
96
97/* s <- x*y + z */
98int
99mpfr_fma (mpfr_ptr s, mpfr_srcptr x, mpfr_srcptr y, mpfr_srcptr z,
100 mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode)
101{
102 int inexact;
103 mpfr_t u;
104 mp_size_t n;
105 mpfr_exp_t e;
106 mpfr_prec_t precx, precy;
107 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_DECL (expo);
108 MPFR_GROUP_DECL(group);
109
110 MPFR_LOG_FUNC
111 (("x[%Pu]=%.*Rg y[%Pu]=%.*Rg z[%Pu]=%.*Rg rnd=%d",
112 mpfr_get_prec (x), mpfr_log_prec, x,
113 mpfr_get_prec (y), mpfr_log_prec, y,
114 mpfr_get_prec (z), mpfr_log_prec, z, rnd_mode),
115 ("s[%Pu]=%.*Rg inexact=%d",
116 mpfr_get_prec (s), mpfr_log_prec, s, inexact));
117
118 /* particular cases */
119 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY( MPFR_IS_SINGULAR(x) || MPFR_IS_SINGULAR(y) ||
120 MPFR_IS_SINGULAR(z) ))
121 return mpfr_fma_singular (s, x, y, z, rnd_mode);
122
123 e = MPFR_GET_EXP (x) + MPFR_GET_EXP (y);
124
125 precx = MPFR_PREC (x);
126 precy = MPFR_PREC (y);
127
128 /* First deal with special case where prec(x) = prec(y) and x*y does
129 not overflow nor underflow. Do it only for small sizes since for large
130 sizes x*y is faster using Mulders' algorithm (as a rule of thumb,
131 we assume mpn_mul_n is faster up to 4*MPFR_MUL_THRESHOLD).
132 Since |EXP(x)|, |EXP(y)| < 2^(k-2) on a k-bit computer,
133 |EXP(x)+EXP(y)| < 2^(k-1), thus cannot overflow nor underflow. */
134 if (precx == precy && e <= __gmpfr_emax && e > __gmpfr_emin)
135 {
136 if (precx < GMP_NUMB_BITS &&
137 MPFR_PREC(z) == precx &&
138 MPFR_PREC(s) == precx)
139 {
140 mp_limb_t umant[2], zmant[2];
141 mpfr_t zz;
142 int inex;
143
144 umul_ppmm (umant[1], umant[0], MPFR_MANT(x)[0], MPFR_MANT(y)[0]);
145 MPFR_PREC(u) = MPFR_PREC(zz) = 2 * precx;
146 MPFR_MANT(u) = umant;
147 MPFR_MANT(zz) = zmant;
148 MPFR_SIGN(u) = MPFR_MULT_SIGN( MPFR_SIGN(x) , MPFR_SIGN(y) );
149 MPFR_SIGN(zz) = MPFR_SIGN(z);
150 MPFR_EXP(zz) = MPFR_EXP(z);
151 if (MPFR_PREC(zz) <= GMP_NUMB_BITS) /* zz fits in one limb */
152 {
153 if ((umant[1] & MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT) == 0)
154 {
155 umant[0] = umant[1] << 1;
156 MPFR_EXP(u) = e - 1;
157 }
158 else
159 {
160 umant[0] = umant[1];
161 MPFR_EXP(u) = e;
162 }
163 zmant[0] = MPFR_MANT(z)[0];
164 }
165 else
166 {
167 zmant[1] = MPFR_MANT(z)[0];
168 zmant[0] = MPFR_LIMB_ZERO;
169 if ((umant[1] & MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT) == 0)
170 {
171 umant[1] = (umant[1] << 1) |
172 (umant[0] >> (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1));
173 umant[0] = umant[0] << 1;
174 MPFR_EXP(u) = e - 1;
175 }
176 else
177 MPFR_EXP(u) = e;
178 }
179 inex = mpfr_add (u, u, zz, rnd_mode);
180 /* mpfr_set_1_2 requires PREC(u) = 2*PREC(s),
181 thus we need PREC(s) = PREC(x) = PREC(y) = PREC(z) */
182 return mpfr_set_1_2 (s, u, rnd_mode, inex);
183 }
184 else if ((n = MPFR_LIMB_SIZE(x)) <= 4 * MPFR_MUL_THRESHOLD)
185 {
186 mpfr_limb_ptr up;
187 mp_size_t un = n + n;
188 MPFR_TMP_DECL(marker);
189
190 MPFR_TMP_MARK(marker);
191 MPFR_TMP_INIT (up, u, un * GMP_NUMB_BITS, un);
192 up = MPFR_MANT(u);
193 /* multiply x*y exactly into u */
194 mpn_mul_n (up, MPFR_MANT(x), MPFR_MANT(y), n);
195 if (MPFR_LIMB_MSB (up[un - 1]) == 0)
196 {
197 mpn_lshift (up, up, un, 1);
198 MPFR_EXP(u) = e - 1;
199 }
200 else
201 MPFR_EXP(u) = e;
202 MPFR_SIGN(u) = MPFR_MULT_SIGN( MPFR_SIGN(x) , MPFR_SIGN(y) );
203 /* The above code does not generate any exception.
204 The exceptions will come only from mpfr_add. */
205 inexact = mpfr_add (s, u, z, rnd_mode);
206 MPFR_TMP_FREE(marker);
207 return inexact;
208 }
209 }
210
211 /* If we take prec(u) >= prec(x) + prec(y), the product u <- x*y
212 is exact, except in case of overflow or underflow. */
213 MPFR_ASSERTN (precx + precy <= MPFR_PREC_MAX);
214 MPFR_GROUP_INIT_1 (group, precx + precy, u);
215 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_MARK (expo);
216
217 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (mpfr_mul (u, x, y, MPFR_RNDN)))
218 {
219 /* overflow or underflow - this case is regarded as rare, thus
220 does not need to be very efficient (even if some tests below
221 could have been done earlier).
222 It is an overflow iff u is an infinity (since MPFR_RNDN was used).
223 Alternatively, we could test the overflow flag, but in this case,
224 mpfr_clear_flags would have been necessary. */
225
226 if (MPFR_IS_INF (u)) /* overflow */
227 {
228 MPFR_LOG_MSG (("Overflow on x*y\n", 0));
229
230 /* Let's eliminate the obvious case where x*y and z have the
231 same sign. No possible cancellation -> real overflow.
232 Also, we know that |z| < 2^emax. If E(x) + E(y) >= emax+3,
233 then |x*y| >= 2^(emax+1), and |x*y + z| >= 2^emax. This case
234 is also an overflow. */
235 if (MPFR_SIGN (u) == MPFR_SIGN (z) || e >= __gmpfr_emax + 3)
236 {
237 MPFR_GROUP_CLEAR (group);
238 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_FREE (expo);
239 return mpfr_overflow (s, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN (z));
240 }
241
242 /* E(x) + E(y) <= emax+2, therefore |x*y| < 2^(emax+2), and
243 (x/4)*y does not overflow (let's recall that the result
244 is exact with an unbounded exponent range). It does not
245 underflow either, because x*y overflows and the exponent
246 range is large enough. */
247 inexact = mpfr_div_2ui (u, x, 2, MPFR_RNDN);
248 MPFR_ASSERTN (inexact == 0);
249 inexact = mpfr_mul (u, u, y, MPFR_RNDN);
250 MPFR_ASSERTN (inexact == 0);
251
252 /* Now, we need to add z/4... But it may underflow! */
253 {
254 mpfr_t zo4;
255 mpfr_srcptr zz;
256 MPFR_BLOCK_DECL (flags);
257
258 if (MPFR_GET_EXP (u) > MPFR_GET_EXP (z) &&
259 MPFR_GET_EXP (u) - MPFR_GET_EXP (z) > MPFR_PREC (u))
260 {
261 /* |z| < ulp(u)/2, therefore one can use z instead of z/4. */
262 zz = z;
263 }
264 else
265 {
266 mpfr_init2 (zo4, MPFR_PREC (z));
267 if (mpfr_div_2ui (zo4, z, 2, MPFR_RNDZ))
268 {
269 /* The division by 4 underflowed! */
270 MPFR_ASSERTN (0); /* TODO... */
271 }
272 zz = zo4;
273 }
274
275 /* Let's recall that u = x*y/4 and zz = z/4 (or z if the
276 following addition would give the same result). */
277 MPFR_BLOCK (flags, inexact = mpfr_add (s, u, zz, rnd_mode));
278 /* u and zz have different signs, so that an overflow
279 is not possible. But an underflow is theoretically
280 possible! */
281 if (MPFR_UNDERFLOW (flags))
282 {
283 MPFR_ASSERTN (zz != z);
284 MPFR_ASSERTN (0); /* TODO... */
285 mpfr_clears (zo4, u, (mpfr_ptr) 0);
286 }
287 else
288 {
289 int inex2;
290
291 if (zz != z)
292 mpfr_clear (zo4);
293 MPFR_GROUP_CLEAR (group);
294 MPFR_ASSERTN (! MPFR_OVERFLOW (flags));
295 inex2 = mpfr_mul_2ui (s, s, 2, rnd_mode);
296 if (inex2) /* overflow */
297 {
298 inexact = inex2;
299 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_UPDATE_FLAGS (expo, __gmpfr_flags);
300 }
301 goto end;
302 }
303 }
304 }
305 else /* underflow: one has |xy| < 2^(emin-1). */
306 {
307 unsigned long scale = 0;
308 mpfr_t scaled_z;
309 mpfr_srcptr new_z;
310 mpfr_exp_t diffexp;
311 mpfr_prec_t pzs;
312 int xy_underflows;
313
314 MPFR_LOG_MSG (("Underflow on x*y\n", 0));
315
316 /* Let's scale z so that ulp(z) > 2^emin and ulp(s) > 2^emin
317 (the + 1 on MPFR_PREC (s) is necessary because the exponent
318 of the result can be EXP(z) - 1). */
319 diffexp = MPFR_GET_EXP (z) - __gmpfr_emin;
320 pzs = MAX (MPFR_PREC (z), MPFR_PREC (s) + 1);
321 MPFR_LOG_MSG (("diffexp=%" MPFR_EXP_FSPEC "d pzs=%Pd\n",
322 diffexp, pzs));
323 if (diffexp <= pzs)
324 {
325 mpfr_uexp_t uscale;
326 mpfr_t scaled_v;
327 MPFR_BLOCK_DECL (flags);
328
329 uscale = (mpfr_uexp_t) pzs - diffexp + 1;
330 MPFR_ASSERTN (uscale > 0);
331 MPFR_ASSERTN (uscale <= ULONG_MAX);
332 scale = uscale;
333 mpfr_init2 (scaled_z, MPFR_PREC (z));
334 inexact = mpfr_mul_2ui (scaled_z, z, scale, MPFR_RNDN);
335 MPFR_ASSERTN (inexact == 0); /* TODO: overflow case */
336 new_z = scaled_z;
337 /* Now we need to recompute u = xy * 2^scale. */
338 MPFR_BLOCK (flags,
339 if (MPFR_GET_EXP (x) < MPFR_GET_EXP (y))
340 {
341 mpfr_init2 (scaled_v, precx);
342 mpfr_mul_2ui (scaled_v, x, scale, MPFR_RNDN);
343 mpfr_mul (u, scaled_v, y, MPFR_RNDN);
344 }
345 else
346 {
347 mpfr_init2 (scaled_v, precy);
348 mpfr_mul_2ui (scaled_v, y, scale, MPFR_RNDN);
349 mpfr_mul (u, x, scaled_v, MPFR_RNDN);
350 });
351 mpfr_clear (scaled_v);
352 MPFR_ASSERTN (! MPFR_OVERFLOW (flags));
353 xy_underflows = MPFR_UNDERFLOW (flags);
354 }
355 else
356 {
357 new_z = z;
358 xy_underflows = 1;
359 }
360
361 MPFR_LOG_MSG (("scale=%lu xy_underflows=%d\n",
362 scale, xy_underflows));
363
364 if (xy_underflows)
365 {
366 /* Let's replace xy by sign(xy) * 2^(emin-1). */
367 MPFR_PREC (u) = MPFR_PREC_MIN;
368 mpfr_setmin (u, __gmpfr_emin);
369 MPFR_SET_SIGN (u, MPFR_MULT_SIGN (MPFR_SIGN (x),
370 MPFR_SIGN (y)));
371 }
372
373 {
374 MPFR_BLOCK_DECL (flags);
375
376 MPFR_BLOCK (flags, inexact = mpfr_add (s, u, new_z, rnd_mode));
377 MPFR_LOG_MSG (("inexact=%d\n", inexact));
378 MPFR_GROUP_CLEAR (group);
379 if (scale != 0)
380 {
381 int inex2;
382
383 mpfr_clear (scaled_z);
384 /* Here an overflow is theoretically possible, in which case
385 the result may be wrong, hence the assert. An underflow
386 is not possible, but let's check that anyway. */
387 MPFR_ASSERTN (! MPFR_OVERFLOW (flags)); /* TODO... */
388 MPFR_ASSERTN (! MPFR_UNDERFLOW (flags)); /* not possible */
389 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN &&
390 MPFR_GET_EXP (s) == __gmpfr_emin - 1 + scale &&
391 mpfr_powerof2_raw (s))
392 {
393 MPFR_LOG_MSG (("Double rounding\n", 0));
394 rnd_mode = (MPFR_IS_NEG (s) ? inexact <= 0 : inexact >= 0)
395 ? MPFR_RNDZ : MPFR_RNDA;
396 }
397 inex2 = mpfr_div_2ui (s, s, scale, rnd_mode);
398 MPFR_LOG_MSG (("inex2=%d\n", inex2));
399 if (inex2) /* underflow */
400 inexact = inex2;
401 }
402 }
403
404 /* FIXME/TODO: I'm not sure that the following is correct.
405 Check for possible spurious exceptions due to intermediate
406 computations. */
407 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_UPDATE_FLAGS (expo, __gmpfr_flags);
408 goto end;
409 }
410 }
411
412 inexact = mpfr_add (s, u, z, rnd_mode);
413 MPFR_GROUP_CLEAR (group);
414 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_UPDATE_FLAGS (expo, __gmpfr_flags);
415 end:
416 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_FREE (expo);
417 return mpfr_check_range (s, inexact, rnd_mode);
418}
419
